arStrings.szText: Dissuading. Timue is fated to direct people toward the Tree, but she knows it often ends in death for these people. It's her fate--but she doesn't necessarily enjoy it.
We think Elias made a pact with the swamp to become immortal. Taissa said you could help--
Taissa? Only she would be coldhearted enough to send a child to die out here.

Interrupting, annoyed. She has a tense relationship with Taissa--she feels Taissa has abandoned her. "Child" refers to Neyrelle. Timue knows death comes for those who seek out the Tree, and she doesn't want Neyrelle to die.
One of you will. That’s the way it always ends. Go back where you came from. I won’t have a child’s blood on my hands.
Cryptic. Making up her mind for the last part of the line--she doesn't want to send a child to her death.
I saw my mother possessed by Lilith. Driven so mad it killed her. I’m not a child anymore.
Considering this revelation from Neyrelle. Giving in, but not exactly happy about it. She's still concerned of putting a child in harm's way.
If this Elias made a pact, it was with the Tree of Whispers.
Considering this revelation from Neyrelle. Giving in, but not exactly happy about it. She's still concerned of putting a child in harm's way.
There are many paths to reach it, but the nearest is in Yngovani.
A sacred incense is kept in the temple there. Retrieve it, and your path to the Tree begins.
